page.title: 11EDUCATION IN BALSALL COMMON
page.content: The first school in Balsall Common was built by the Church of England in 1875 about 100 metres away from the present school. It consisted of 16 children in one room about the size of a modern temporary classroom. In 1879 the school had 57 children and 11 years later 73 children. This classroom was lit by candles and heated by a coal fire. In 1913 the council took over Education and the school moved across the road. It had four classrooms, cloakrooms and a handicraft room. Subjects included cookery, needlework woodwork and growing flowers and vegtables. Water came from a pump and candles and coal fires were still used. It started with 70 children but soon all the classrooms were filled. EVE TONGUE
